paper_abstract: The R package SIMoNe (Statistical Inference for MOdular NEtworks) enables inference of gene-regulatory networks based on partial correlation coefficients from microarray experiments. Modelling gene expression data with a Gaussian graphical model (hereafter GGM), the algorithm estimates non-zero entries of the concentration matrix, in a sparse and possibly high-dimensional setting. Its originality lies in the fact that it searches for a latent modular structure to drive the inference procedure through adaptive penalization of the concentration matrix.
paper_title: SIMoNe: Statistical Inference for MOdular NEtworks
